Dear Mack McGhee:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Vivian Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/31/25, a youth strangled another youth until the youth
became unconscious. The youth then fell to the ground and hit
their head. There is bruising as a result. Staff was present, but did
not intervene quickly enough.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed by phone on 03/13/2025 with
another Department of Health and Human Service (DHHS)
Worker. Complainant stated he contacted Central Intake on
03/03/2025 when he became aware of this 01/31/2025 incident.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/06/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Youth A stated he was on
the right side of Unit 3C horseplaying with Youth B. Youth A stated
Youth B stood behind him and wrapped an arm around Youth A’s
neck. Youth A stated he passed out, fell to the ground and hit the
left side of his head on the ground when Youth B let go of him.
Youth A stated he does not recall any details after falling to the
ground but stated he was evaluated by a nurse. Youth A stated he
was on a one staff to one youth ratio when this incident occurred
but does not recall the staff assigned or the other staff on the unit.
Youth A stated he does not recall staff verbally redirecting or
physically intervening in this incident.
Youth A’s Worker stated by phone on 03/10/2025 that Youth A
wants to be transferred to another unit that houses a friend. Youth
A’s Worker stated Youth A believes acting out behaviorally will
force Wayne County Juvenile Detention to transfer him to this unit.
2

Youth B was interviewed at his current placement on 03/17/2025.
Youth B stated he had a playful relationship with Youth A. Youth B
stated Youth A asked him to choke him. Youth B stated he stood
behind Youth A, placed one arm around Youth A’s neck and
Youth A pulled Youth B’s arm tighter around his neck. Youth B
stated he thought Youth A was acting when someone (does not
know who) said Youth A’s “eyes are rolling back”. Youth B stated
Staff 1 and Staff 2 told him to stop playing and to let go of Youth
A. Youth B stated he released Youth A and Youth A fell to the
ground and landed on his back with a “loud thump” when his head
hit the ground. Youth B stated Staff 1, Staff 2 and a nurse checked
on Youth A. Youth B stated he did not expect Youth A to fall to the
ground and was unsure if Youth A was unconscious or pretending
to be. Youth B stated Youth A did not say anything or make a
noise when he was choked. Youth B denied picking Youth A up in
the choke hold. Youth B stated he went to the other side of the
unit because he was scared that he injured Youth A but relieved
once he saw Youth A get up on his own and sit down in the
wheelchair.
Youth C was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/06/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Youth C stated Youth A
asks to be punched or choked because he wants to kill himself.
Youth C stated Youth B wrapped an arm around Youth A’s neck
and picked him up off the ground. Youth C stated Youth A turned
red and “hit the ground hard like a gunshot” when Youth B let go
of him. Youth C stated Youth B was scared when Youth A was on
the ground shaking and asked to go to his room. Youth C stated
assistance was called and a nurse came took Youth A off the unit
in a wheelchair.
Youth D was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/13/2025. Youth D stated he did not witness Youth B choke
Youth A but heard Youth A ask Youth B to choke him. Youth D
stated he then saw Youth A lying on the ground.
Youth E was interviewed by another DHHS Worker at Wayne
County Juvenile Detention on 03/13/2025. Youth E stated he did
not witness the incident but heard Youth A offer his merits (extra
snacks) to any youth that would choke him.
Staff 1 was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/27/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated she was
assigned to Youth A as his one staff to one youth ratio for his self-
harm ideation. Staff 1 stated she redirected Youth A and Youth B
to stop playing around. Staff 1 stated Youth B stood behind Youth
3

A and placed one or both arms around Youth A’s neck. Staff 1
stated Youth A laughed at first but then rolled his eyes back. Staff
1 stated she moved Youth B’s hand away from Youth A’s neck
and verbally directed Youth B to release Youth A. Staff 1 stated
Youth A was released, fell to the ground on his backside and hit
his head on the ground. Staff 1 stated a nurse came to the unit
and checked Youth A’s vitals. Staff 1 stated Youth A got up on his
own to sit in a wheelchair and wheeled off the unit to medical
services to see the doctor. Staff 1 stated Youth A cried and
complained of numbness on his right side and was given an ice
pack and ibuprofen. Staff 1 stated Youth A spoke with a crisis
therapist when he returned to the unit. Staff 1 denied hearing
Youth A offer his extra snacks in exchange for being choked or
punched.
Staff 2 was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/21/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Staff 2 stated Youth A
wants to die and wants someone to kill him and was on a one staff
to one youth ratio on 01/31/2025. Staff 2 stated Youth A and
Youth B were horseplaying when Youth B stood behind Youth A
and placed him in a headlock (arm around Youth A's neck). Staff 2
stated Staff 1 stood in front of Youth A and Youth B and directed
them to stop playing. Staff 2 stated she pulled Youth B’s arm away
from Youth A and Youth A swayed with his knees bent and
collapsed to the ground on his backside and hit his head on the
ground. Staff 2 stated a nurse had just left the unit and returned
quickly to assess Youth A. Staff 2 stated she called for assistance
and directed the youths to stay away from Youth A.
Former Staff resigned from Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/14/2025. Messages were left for Former Staff on 03/21/2025
and 03/26/2025 for an interview and a return call was not
received.
Supervisor was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention
on 03/27/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Supervisor stated she
does not recall where Youth A was positioned on the unit when
she responded to the assistance call. Supervisor stated Youth B
said he choked Youth A because Youth A asked him. Supervisor
stated Youth A complained of his head hurting and was sent to
medical services for an evaluation. Supervisor stated horseplaying
is not permitted and staff are to redirect horseplay.
Therapist resigned from Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
02/14/2025. Therapist answered her phone on 03/12/2025 and
stated it was not a good time for an interview. A phone interview
4

date and time was established for 03/17/2025. Therapist did not
answer her phone on 03/17/2025 for the interview. Messages
were left on 03/17/2025 and 03/19/2025 and a return call was not
received.
Video
01/31/2025 video of Unit 3C was reviewed. Video does not record
sound. Video shows Youth B sitting in a chair in the common area
close to the unit door with Youth C sitting in his own chair to the
right of Youth B. Youth A walks past Youth B to the unit door,
walks back and stops in front of Youth B with Staff 1 following.
Staff 2 sits nearby with her back to the wall and writes in the
logbook. Youth B stands up behind Youth A. Staff 1 stands in front
of Youth A and Youth B and Staff 2 looks at Youth A and Youth B.
Youth B hooks his right arm around Youth A’s neck and places his
left forearm against the side of Youth A’s head with his left hand
on top of Youth A’s head. Youth A places his hands on Youth B's
right arm and coughs. Youth A is either lifted up by Youth B or he
stands on his tip toes. Youth B steps back and Youth A moves his
right foot onto a chair. Staff 1 physically intervenes by holding
Youth A’s left arm and pulling Youth B’s left arm and hand away
from Youth A. Staff 2 gets up from the chair, walks up and taps
Youth B’s left hand away from Youth A’s head and uses her
walkie talkie. Youth B releases Youth A. Youth A’s knees bend
and he falls backwards into a chair and then falls to the ground on
his backside. Youth B tries to assist Youth A up and moves his
hand over the top and back of Youth A’s head. Staff 3 and youths
approach. Staff 3 guides Youth B away from Youth A. Staff 1 and
Staff 2 check on Youth A. Youth B has his left arm placed around
Youth A’s neck from approximately 1:22:13 PM to 1:22:37 PM.
Tour
Upon entering the right side of Unit 3C one steps into a common
area with youth rooms surrounding this area. The common area
has a wall mounted television and large residential quality chairs.
This area is where Youth B choked Youth A.
Documentation
Staff 1 wrote an incident report dated 01/31/2025 that coincides
with her interview.
Staff 3 wrote an incident report dated 01/31/2025. It states Youth
A said, “I want to die. Can someone choke me out?” Youth A
offered snacks to any youth, who would choke or hit him. Youth B
grabbed Youth A from behind and choked him. Youth A appeared
5

to lose consciousness. Youth B said, “I didn’t have it tight and it
was only for a few seconds, he faking it.”
01/31/2025 Provider progress note states Youth A denies
remembering the incident, but staff reported Youth A playing with
another youth and fell. It states Youth A has a headache in the
occipital area that is tender to the touch and a left forearm
abrasion. It states Youth A is alert and oriented with pupils
reactive to light. The doctor wrote no hematoma or erythema are
noted in occipital region.
02/01/2025 Nursing note states Youth A had a neurological check.
Youth A was alert and oriented times three with steady gait and
clear speech. Youth A received acetaminophen for a headache.
02/01/2025 Nursing note states Youth A refused evening
medication. Youth A’s pupils were equal, round and reactive to
light. Youth A did not complain of visual disturbance but received
ibuprofen for a headache.
Staff 1 last completed Handle with Care on 12/11/2024 and
12/12/2024. Staff 1 does not have disciplinary action.
Staff 2 last completed Handle with Care on 03/27/2024 and
03/28/2024 (as of this investigation initiation date.) Staff 2 does
not have disciplinary action.
Former Staff last completed Handle with Care on 11/28/2024 and
11/29/2024. Former Staff did not have a discipline history.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Code of Ethics policy and
procedure 3.1 states staff may not horseplay with youth. It does
not have a policy and procedure about youth-on-youth horseplay.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance for providing the needs,
protection and supervision of Youth A and Youth B by allowing
horseplay to result in Youth A choking, falling and hitting his head
on the ground.
CONSULTATION
It is recommended that Wayne County Juvenile Detention have a
policy and procedure regarding youth-on-youth horseplay.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
As a result of the findings in this investigation, a corrective action plan is required.
